Sample.Title: 13-11T-Old

Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA isolated from tissue was spiked with the ERCC Spike-In Mix (equal quantities) and subject to ribosomal RNA removal and sequencing library preparation. Libraries were sequenced (75 bp, single-end) on a NextSeq 550 platform (Illumina) in accordance with the manufacturer’s protocol.

Sample.Data-Processing: RNA-seq reads (including ERCC spike-in controls) were aligned to the human reference genome (assembly GRCh37.75/hg19 concatenated with the sequence of the ERCC transcripts) using STAR with default parameters. Only alignments with mapping score MAPQ of 10 and above were retained. Read counts for the ERCC spike-in transcripts were counted using samtools idxstat function. FeatureCounts was used to generate a matrix of mapped fragments per RefSeq annotated gene. Genome_build: hg19 Supplementary_files_format_and_content: read count per gene

Series.Title: An integrated multi-omics approach identifies epigenetic alterations associated with Alzheimer’s disease (RNA-seq with ERCC spike-in) [RNA-Seq]
Series.Summary: We report the ERCC spike-in controlled RNA-seq in human hippocampus subject to normal aging and Alzheimer's disease.
Series.Overall-Design: ERCC spike-in controlled RNA-seq in postmortal lateral temporal lobe of Alzheimer's disease affected brains (AD), control Old (Old) and control Young (Young).
Series.Type: Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing
